msContents.summary: The Nāṉanaṭcēttiramālai, that is, The garland of celestial knowledge. An anonymous work with this title, in honour of the Holy Mary, has been attributed to Jean Venance Bouchet (1655-1732), a French Jesuit missionnary in South India (see Clooney 2005, p. 73-74). The present manuscript seems to be a copy of the same (TBC).

origin.origDate: No internal date. From the aspect of the leaves and the script style, the manuscript seems to date, at the latest, to the beginning of the 19th century.

acquisition.p: Manuscript hold by M. Bernolle (Île-de-France). The manuscript was acquired by its actual owner from his father, who himself received it as a gift it approximately in the 1960s, from a colleague, probably of Tamil origin.
